comment._content: Nedick's was a hot-dog place. See nyapril1946.blogspot.com/2010/07/dean-martin-at-nedicks.html

comment.author: 94755752@N00
comment._content: I remember my Grandma telling me about Nedick's

comment.author: 97533501@N00
comment._content: That is a Lustron house on display on the corner. Note the classic zig-zag column. They were postwar prefabricated houses, made of enameled steel inside and out. There were various models and variations, but this one almost precisely the same as one a few blocks from here, in Ann Arbor, Mich. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lustron_house
